definition[0]: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed
example[0]: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
definition[1]: to make something continue without changing
example[1]: the responsibility of the police to preserve the peace
example[2]: Norma tried to preserve a normal family life in difficult circumstances.
definition[2]: to store food for a long time after treating it so that it will not decay
definition[3]: a substance made from boiling fruit or vegetables with sugar, salt, or vinegar
definition[4]: an activity that is only suitable or allowed for a particular group of people
example[5]: Banking used to be a male preserve.
example[6]: The civil service became the preserve of the educated middle class.
definition[5]: an area of land or water that is kept for private hunting or fishing
